interpretation: RL shows mean improvement of 26.2% across all distances (d=3,5,7,11,15), but this is NOT statistically significant at alpha=0.01 level (p=0.05). Critical issue: At d=15 (primary target), RL achieves NEGATIVE improvement (-6.7%), failing the core scaling hypothesis. While RL excels at small distances (d=3-7 with 30-57% improvement), it catastrophically fails at d>=11, performing worse than MWPM baseline at d=15. The 95% CI includes negative values, indicating high uncertainty. Hypothesis NOT supported.

d15.conclusion: CRITICAL FAILURE - RL WORSE than MWPM

scaling_analysis.pattern: Strong performance at small distances, catastrophic failure at large distances

reasons: 95% CI at d=15 excludes positive 20% improvement
mitigating_factors: Strong performance at d=3-7 suggests potential with more training

next_steps: Priority 1: Extend training to 1000-5000 steps at d=15
If training extension fails, test reward shaping (H2) and architecture changes (H3)
Repeat with 10 seeds for statistical robustness
